thread.title: Michigan teen warns about possible kidnapping tactic
thread.title_full: Michigan teen warns about possible kidnapping tactic

author: MINYVONNE BURKE
title: Michigan teen warns about possible kidnapping tactic
text:
Michigan teen warns about possible kidnapping tactic after finding shirt wrapped around her windshield wiper Michigan teen warns about possible kidnapping tactic NEW YORK DAILY NEWS   10:02 AM 
A Michigan teen is urging other women to be mindful of their surroundings after experiencing a creepy situation in the parking lot of her job. 
Ashley Hardacre, 19, issued the warning on Facebook after leaving work late one night to find a shirt wrapped around the windshield wiper on her car. 
Hardacre wrote that she had worked the closing shift at a mall in Flint and when she got inside her vehicle she spotted a blue flannel shirt on her windshield. 
"There were two cars near me and one was running so I immediately felt uneasy and knew I couldn't get out to get it off," she wrote. "At first I thought maybe someone had just thrown it on my car for some odd reason." Ashley Hardacre posted a warning message on Facebook after she found a shirt wrapped around her windshield wiper. (Ashley Hardacre/Facebook) 
"I used my windshield wipers to try to get them off but the shirt was completely wrapped around my wiper blade," she continued. 
The teen said instead of getting out to remove the shirt, she drove to a safe place and rolled her window down to get it. 
"I had seen posts lately about people finding things under their windshield wipers in the burton/flint area as an attempt to get girls out of their cars and distracted," Hardacre wrote. 
Since Hardacre posted her message, the Facebook post has been shared over 100,000 times. 
Sarah Dunsey reunites with family in emotional video 
Flint Township Police Detective Sgt. Brad Wangler told CBS News that there haven't been any other reported incidents like Hardacre's but advised people to be "vigilant." 
"If something doesn't seem right, or the hairs on the back of your neck stand up," he said. "But by all means, we need to know about this stuff when it happens." Join the Conversation:
